page.title: 11'GARDEN OPEN TODAY',LYDART
page.content: We open our garden at The Yew Tree to the public at Easter and Whitsun,with entrance contributions going to the National Garden Scheme. Apart from supporting a charity,it is a pleasure to share one's garden with enthusiasts both local and from overseas. Our garden is set on a west facing slope; many visitors relax on the seats at the top of the hill to gaze at the marvellous views of the Welsh hills. Far from being exposed on a hillside,the slope itself allows us to escape from severe frosts and protects the garden from wind. Many visitors,having seen plants new to them are keen to acquire some for their own gardens. As many of our plants are unusual,rare or difficult, we have made the decision to start a nursery to supply such plants to visitors and for sale locally.
